org.sakaiproject.email.impl

Class BasicEmailService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sakaiproject.email.impl.BasicEmailService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.sakaiproject.email.api.EmailService

    public class BasicEmailService
extends Object
implements org.sakaiproject.email.api.EmailService

    BasicEmailService implements the EmailService.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  BasicEmailService.MyMessage
      inspired by http://java.sun.com/products/javamail/FAQ.html#msgid From the FAQ
      Q: I set a particular value for the Message-ID header of my new message, but when I send this message that header is rewritten.

        public static final String MAIL_HOST_T

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAIL_PORT_T

        public static final String MAIL_PORT_T
        The SMTP server port to connect to, if the connect() method doesn't explicitly specify one. Defaults to 25.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAIL_FROM_T

        public static final String MAIL_FROM_T
        Email address to use for SMTP MAIL command. This sets the envelope return address. Defaults to msg.getFrom() or InternetAddress.getLocalAddress(). NOTE: mail.smtp.user was previously used for this.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAIL_SENDPARTIAL_T

        public static final String MAIL_SENDPARTIAL_T
        If set to true, and a message has some valid and some invalid addresses, send the message anyway, reporting the partial failure with a SendFailedException. If set to false (the default), the message is not sent to any of the recipients if there is an invalid recipient address.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAIL_CONNECTIONTIMEOUT_T

        public static final String MAIL_CONNECTIONTIMEOUT_T
        Socket connection timeout value in milliseconds. Default is infinite timeout.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAIL_TIMEOUT_T

        public static final String MAIL_TIMEOUT_T
        Socket I/O timeout value in milliseconds. Default is infinite timeout.

      • m_testMode

        protected boolean m_testMode
        Configuration: set to go into test mode, where mail is not really sent out.

      • allowTransport

        protected boolean allowTransport
        Configuration: turns off transport sending. This can be turned off to allow pr happen normally but only stop calling Transport.send. Allows the code to run t checks and validations that testMode = true does not.

      • m_maxRecipients

        protected int m_maxRecipients
        The max # recipients to include in each message.

      • m_smtpTimeout

        protected String m_smtpTimeout
        Configuration: Socket I/O timeout value in milliseconds. Default is infinite timeout.

      • emails2Internets

        protected InternetAddress[] emails2Internets(List<org.sakaiproject.email.api.EmailAddress> emails,
                                 List<org.sakaiproject.email.api.EmailAddress> invalids)
        Converts a List of EmailAddress to InternetAddress.
        Parameters:
        emails -
        Returns:
        Array will be the same size as the list with converted addresses. If list is null, the array returned will be 0 length (non-null).
        Throws:
        AddressException
        UnsupportedEncodingException

        Flatten a Map to a String
        Parameters:
        map -
        Returns:
        A string representation of the Map. Examples of results include: Standard key/value pairs: [[key1:value1], [key2:value2]] List values: [[key1:value1, value2], [key2:value3, value4]] Map values: [[key1:[key2:value1]], [key3:[key4:value2]]]
